global.dictionaries

Class ReadDictionary

  • java.lang.Object
    • global.dictionaries.ReadDictionary

  • public class ReadDictionary
extends java.lang.Object
    Class uesd to read dictionaries from files All dictionary files should be written in UTF-8 format. the file layout should be: entry1translation1 entry2translation2 entry3translation3 entry4translation4 There is no constraint on entry order but wrong entry names will result in a reading error.
    Author:
    Ophir De Jager

      • readDictionary

        public static java.util.Map<Messages,java.lang.String> readDictionary(java.lang.String filename)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Read the given file and create a dictionary map from it
        Parameters:
        filename - the file name
        Returns:
        a map from entries to translations
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading error occurred or file format was bad

      • filterNonAscii

        private static java.lang.String filterNonAscii(java.lang.String inString)
        Filter non-ASCII characters (needed to match entries with Messages enum types)
        Parameters:
        inString - String to be filtered
        Returns:
        an ASCII String corresponding to the given non-ASCII given String
